The video evidence: The expert would have examined the video footage tweeted by Amit Malviya and Arun Yadav to verify if it indeed showed anti-CAA protesters in Lucknow raising 'Pakistan zindabad' slogans.
Corroborating statements: The expert would have considered the statements made by Meerut SP Akhilesh Narayan Singh and the correspondent Vasudev, who claimed that 'Pakistan zindabad' slogans were raised during the December 13 rally. The expert would have assessed the credibility of these individuals and their accounts.
Investigation status: The expert would have looked into the status of the police investigation mentioned by Vasudev, which aimed to identify who raised the controversial slogans. This would provide additional information on the authenticity of the claim.
Source credibility: The expert would have assessed the credibility of the media outlets and social media accounts that shared the video. This would involve evaluating the reputation and track record of these sources in terms of disseminating accurate and reliable information.
